summary: The Duchy of Saxe-Meiningen was one of the Ernestine duchies.
full_text:
The Duchy of Saxe-Meiningen  was one of the Saxon duchies held by the Ernestine line of the Wettin dynasty, located in the southwest of the present-day German state of Thuringia.
Established in 1681, by partition of the Ernestine duchy of Saxe-Gotha among the seven sons of deceased Duke Ernst der Fromme , the Saxe-Meiningen line of the House of Wettin lasted until the end of the German monarchies in 1918.
title: Saxe-Meiningen
